title: "Teens Become Trans To Get Into Ivy Leagues": JD Vance Triggers Row
content: Republican Vice-Presidential nominee JD Vance recently triggered a row by making controversial remarks on transgender and nonbinary people.

title: Rishi Sunak Celebrates Diwali After Resigning As Opposition Leader

title: Video Emerges Months After Firing Outside Singer AP Dhillon's Canada House
content: A video has emerged showing several rounds being fired at Punjabi singer AP Dhillon's house in Canada. Two vehicles were also set on fire during the September 2 incident in Vancouver. The singer was not injured in the shooting.
summary: A video has emerged showing several rounds being fired at Punjabi singer AP Dhillon's house in Canada. Two vehicles were also set on fire during the September 2 incident in Vancouver. The singer was not injured in the shooting.

title: Over 400 Alleged Sex Abuse Victims Of Ex Harrods Boss Come Forward
content: A BBC documentary in September revealed Al Fayed sexually abused female staff at his London department store Harrods.
summary: A BBC documentary in September revealed Al Fayed sexually abused female staff at his London department store Harrods.

title: Why Russia Has Fined Google $20,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000
content: The unprecedented penalty targets YouTube, owned by Google's parent company Alphabet, over the platform's decision to block Russian state-run media channels in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
summary: The unprecedented penalty targets YouTube, owned by Google's parent company Alphabet, over the platform's decision to block Russian state-run media channels in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Over 150 Dead In Spain's Worst Flood-Related Disaster

title: Why US Votes In November But Inaugurates New President In January
content: The United States has an electoral system and calendar unlike no other country. The nation votes in November but the new President is inaugurated in January.
summary: The United States has an electoral system and calendar unlike no other country. The nation votes in November but the new President is inaugurated in January.

title: Donald Trump May Challenge Results If He Loses, But What Are His Options

title: North Korea Says It Test-Fired Latest ICBM Hwasong-19 On Thursday
content: North Korea on Friday said it test-fired the latest intercontinental ballistic missile Hwasong-19 on Thursday, calling it a final and complete version, the Yonhap news agency reported.

title: US Elections: 60 Million Cast Early Votes In Kamala Harris-Trump Tight Race
content: With just a few days to go for the United States elections, a staggering 61.0 million Americans have already made their voices heard by casting their ballots in the November election, according to a report by CNN.

title: Blinken Says 8,000 North Korean Troops Deployed In Russia's Kursk Region
content: US Secretary of State Anthony Blinken on Thursday revealed that approximately 10,000 North Korean soldiers are currently in Russia, with around 8,000 deployed in the Kursk region.

title: Iran Preparing Strike On Israel From Iraqi Territory Within Days: Reports
content: Israeli intelligence suggests Iran is preparing to attack Israel from Iraqi territory in the coming days, possibly before the U.S. presidential election on Nov. 5, Axios reported on Thursday, citing two unidentified Israeli sources.
summary: Israeli intelligence suggests Iran is preparing to attack Israel from Iraqi territory in the coming days, possibly before the U.S. presidential election on Nov. 5, Axios reported on Thursday, citing two unidentified Israeli sources.

title: Google Wins Trademark Suit Over YouTube Shorts, Court Rules No Confusion
content: Google on Thursday defeated a trademark lawsuit brought by a British short film company over YouTube's short video platform Shorts, with London's High Court ruling there was no risk of confusion for consumers.

title: Germany To Shut Down Iranian Consulates Over Execution Of Dual National
content: Germany will shut all Iranian consulates in Germany but allow the embassy to remain open in reaction to the execution of a German-Iranian national, the foreign ministry said on Thursday.
summary: Germany will shut all Iranian consulates in Germany but allow the embassy to remain open in reaction to the execution of a German-Iranian national, the foreign ministry said on Thursday.

title: Not Enough Time In Universe For Monkeys To Pen Shakespeare: Study
content: This thought experiment has long been used to express how an infinite amount of time makes something that is incredibly unlikely -- but still technically possible -- become probable.

title: US Election 2024: All About Green Party Nominee Jill Stein
